quest.name: Let Bygones Be Bygones
journal: Gullinkambi is prepared to see the healing of man in action.

Gullinkambi reminds you that dragons are wont to let nature take its course when healing, but she has no objections to using knowledge of the tablet to help Ohl Ahs. She asks that you take Kal Myhk with you as you prepare the medicine described on the tablet.

Kal Myhk asks you what ingredients are required for the medicine, and after examining the faded tome, you find the recipe calls for wyvern tails. He tells you they can be found northeast of Anyx Trine. Journey to the Iron Feast and locate the items.
You traverse the narrow cliffs of the mountain and acquire wyvern tails. Return to Anyx Trine and confer with Kal Myhk regarding your next course of action.

Examining the tablet further, you discern the next step is an infusion of the wyvern tails, which extracts their healing properties with boiling water. Travel to Camp Tailfeather and seek out tools for the infusion.

You search Camp Tailfeather and the surrounding area and come across a small camp with a pot over a roaring fire. After speaking with the camp's residents, they agree to let you use the pot and produce a wyvern tail infusion. Return to Anyx Trine and show Kal Myhk the fruits of your labor.

You return to Anyx Trine, and Kal Myhk is thrilled at the thought of seeing his brother make a swift recovery. With the infusion in hand, there is only one thing left to do: meet Kal Myhk inside Mourn and prepare to treat Ohl Ahs.
You find Kal Myhk just beyond the mouth of Mourn and his brother is fast asleep. Apply the wyvern tail infusion to his wounds, but try not to wake him.

You carefully apply the infusion, but upon closer inspection find broken spear tips still lodged in his wounds. Their removal awakens Ohl Ahs who is displeased to see his sleep disturbed, more so by the fact that it was your doing. However, his anger is soon abated as he realizes the pain that gripped him for so long is finally gone. Kal Myhk explains that it was you who labored to treat his injuries, and helps him understand that not all people are wicked. Return to Anyx Trine, and inform Gullinkambi that the treatment was a success.

You arrive at Anyx Trine, and Gullinkambi can tell by your look of satisfaction that Ohl Ahs has recovered from his injuries. She thanks you for all you have done not only to heal Ohl Ahs, but also fostering the first of many friendships to come between dragons and mankind.
objectives: Obtain wyvern tails from the Iron Feast.
Search Camp Tailfeather for a means to infuse the wyvern tails.
Use the wyvern infusion to treat Ohl Ahs.

dialogue.name: GULLINKAMBI
dialogue.text: Dragons follow the natural order. However, if you wish to heal Ohl Ahs, I will not forbid it. Take Kal with you, and prepare the remedy inscribed on the tablet.

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: We must hurry and prepare the medicine. Retrieve the tablet from Mother so we may begin.

dialogue.name: GULLINKAMBI
dialogue.text: If you would grant succor to Ohl Ahs, prepare the remedy inscribed on the tablet.

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: At last we can help Brother! Tell me, Forename, what is required for this remedy to work?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Centuries of wind and rain have worn the tablet glyphs, but you manage to discern the remedy calls for “wyvern tails.”

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: Wyvern tails? A peculiar name for a peculiar plant. They grow mainly near trees to the northeast, where water pours from the great ruins. Take what you can find from there. I will search along the cliffs up above.

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: When you've found the wyvern tails, bring them back here. Take care, Forename.

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: Were you able to find the wyvern tails? I fear they grow in short supply.

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: Excellent. There was but a small helping along the cliffs, but I found them. Now, how do we prepare the remedy?

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: Infusion? I'm not familiar with this...infusion. This sounds like work that cannot be done alone, but requires the skillful hands of man. I will leave this next step to you, Forename.

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: When you are finished, return here with the remedy.

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: I'm not sure I understand what infusion is, but if it will help Brother, I will try anything.

dialogue.name: LEONULFE
dialogue.text: Well, hello there. What brings you to these parts?

dialogue.name: LEONULFE
dialogue.text: Use of my pot? I s'pose, but mind tellin' me what you plan to do with it?

dialogue.name: LEONULFE
dialogue.text: An infusion to treat a dragon? Well, blow me down. Never thought such a thing could be done. Hope you can put it to good use.

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: Is the infusion complete? I wish to see what the remedy looks like.

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: Excellent work. You never cease to impress me. But how do we use this to help Brother?

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: I see. Merely pouring that over the wounds will promote healing and ease Brother's pain? This is good.

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: Keeping the wounds clean will be easy, letting him recover much faster.

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: Let us be off to Mourn, then. The sooner Brother is healed, the better.

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: Tread softly, lest we wake him.

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: Now, pour the remedy over his wounds.

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: Is the remedy working? Can you see any changes in Brother?

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: Something protruding from the wounds!? Please, remove them if you can!

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename. That should do well to ease Brother's pain, and let the remedy take hold quicker.

dialogue.name: OHLAHS
dialogue.text:
Hm...!? Why do you disturb me from rest!? And you dare insult me by bringing that despicable filth with you! Can you not see the pain I am─
...The pain. It's...it's gone.

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: Listen, Brother. Forename has treated you with medicine, and removed the strange objects embedded in your flesh.

dialogue.name: OHLAHS
dialogue.text: Hmph! A wasted effort. A dragon needs only sleep to mend its wounds, not the foolish tricks of man.

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: Brother, please hear me. It is true we dragons heal with sleep. But it requires time we cannot afford.

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: Would you willingly choose to lie here, writhing in agony?

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: With only claws and fangs, I could do nothing but watch you suffer. But Forename has helped you in ways no dragon can.

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: I cannot deny there are men who mean to do us harm. But Brother, surely you understand now there are those who would aid us. Can you not see that Forename is a friend to us?

dialogue.name: OHLAHS
dialogue.text: Make no mistake, Brother. HerHis kindness does not atone for the evils I have suffered, for our kin slain by the men of Ishgard.

dialogue.name: OHLAHS
dialogue.text: But as man has drawn my blood, man has also granted me succor.

dialogue.name: OHLAHS
dialogue.text: Your kindness will not be forgotten, Forename... Thank you.

dialogue.name: OHLAHS
dialogue.text: Times are not what they once were. That much is clear. Trust does not come to me quite so easily, but I will give thought to the matter of men.

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: That is all I could ask for, Brother. Thank you. Come Forename, let us tell Mother that the remedy was a success!

dialogue.name: OHLAHS
dialogue.text: Pour the remedy over his wounds, but try not to wake him.

dialogue.name: GULLINKAMBI
dialogue.text: Your expression tells me much. I see the remedy was effective.

dialogue.name: GULLINKAMBI
dialogue.text: With Ohl Ahs recovered, I would take back the tablet.

dialogue.name: GULLINKAMBI
dialogue.text: Though he has long since perished, his legacy will live on in his work─a boon to our kind.

dialogue.name: GULLINKAMBI
dialogue.text: I will keep close guard over it. When man and dragon at last make amends, there may come a time when we have need of its knowledge.

dialogue.name: GULLINKAMBI
dialogue.text: This time, I will make sure it is not so uneasily reached; a place where even unwinged allies will not labor to retrieve it.

dialogue.name: GULLINKAMBI
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename. I hope you are but the first of many to befriend Kal Myhk, and someday the rest of our kind.

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: We are in your debt, Forename. It will take time, but your kindness will be repaid. Until we meet again.

dialogue.name: KALMYHK
dialogue.text: You are a true friend, Forename. Thank you for everything.

dialogue.name: OHLAHS
dialogue.text: A world where dragons live alongside man? An interesting thought... Perhaps someday.
